website_summaries.verdict: Delivers what you need in a squat pad with just the right level of cushioning at a desirable price point.
pros: Includes a hook-and-loop closure system to affix the squat pad to the weight lifting bar, which ensures that it will stay in place nicely
Should fit the majority of weight lifting bars you'd be using
Comfortable to use, yet it also will give you a nice level of support
cons: May not last as long as some other squat pads when you use it daily and place it under constant stress

customer_reviews.title: this is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: for over two years i have been killing my neck during squats,now with this i dont dread squats anymore! Dont know why i didnt buy it sooner! Totally recommend for anyone who lifts! I even use it when i do weighted barbell hip thrusts,trust me,your groin will thank you for buying one!
customer_reviews.author: bnb

customer_reviews.title: Thick Padding
customer_reviews.text: The padding might be thicker than you realize. It’s comfortable and is stable on the bar. But if you’re looking for something that provides a little bit of padding and still gives you a good feel for the bar, this pad isn’t for you.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C.

customer_reviews.title: Your basic (good) barbell pad
customer_reviews.text: This is good barbell pad that you can't go wrong with. It fits olympic bars just fine. The padding is pretty standard - that is to say adequate. Its, of course, way better than a bare bare. If you are used to other standard pads this will be about the same. If you are new to having a bar across your shoulders then any standard pad is going to feel inadequate at first - until you get used to the feel and find the exact right positioning on your shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: UTBadger

customer_reviews.title: Not using as barbell padding, but it works great for my purpose...read on...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for an unconventional use - to cover a portion of my stand-up paddle board paddle. It have a 2-piece paddle and I was fearful that I would accidentally eject and lose the bottom part of the paddle when on the water. I would accidentally grab that area when using my board as a kayak. So I got creative, did some measuring and realized that the diameter of my paddle is the same as my OLY lifting bar. It works very well for this use, and should I ever need it for the barbell, it will serve 2 purposes!
customer_reviews.author: J Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Dude it's awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. It has velcro to help keep it on, I like that it has the protective covering that's easy to wipe off if it gets dirty and protects the foam from ripping. I've used several of the foam ones at the gym and they always end up ripping apart. I can take this around with me in the car or stroller without worrying about it being torn up on the way. It's the same price as those cheap ones. Definitely get it!
customer_reviews.author: Ariel LaGrange

customer_reviews.title: good quality materials
customer_reviews.text: This pad is well constructed, good quality materials. It may be a bit thinner than other similar pads. I bought three "different" (but similar) barbell pads at the same time. I chose to use another one, which I find to be a bit more comfortable. But someone else may find this one to be "perfect" for them. There is really nothing wrong with this pad.
customer_reviews.author: Richard LeNoir

customer_reviews.title: Good if it fits
customer_reviews.text: Seems a bit small for the Smith Machine at my gym, and keeps popping off. Still when it's on the padding is great.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: It delivered very fast. the padding is very dense and sturdy. it does NOT budge on my bar! the velcro is very sticky, so thats great. i use it for hip thrust but could use a bit more padding. I use it for squats to works perfectly cant feel the bar at all. It fits my Olympic size barbell perfectly also
customer_reviews.author: 29PalmsBabe

customer_reviews.title: Best bar pad I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best bar pad I've ever used!! The Velcro hides real well so that even if it does roll around, still no discomfort. Thicker than the ones I've used at my old gym. Stays nice and snug on bar for squats. I also like to use it on the bar for dead lifts so I can keep the bar close to my legs without worrying about bumping my knees in a painful way. Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanna

customer_reviews.title: Good for using at 24 Hour Gyms on the 2" thick barbells
customer_reviews.text: Good pad for using at the gym. It's wide enough on the inside to fit the barbells at 24 Hour Fitness. The only downside is it is a little stiffer than my previous one (but my previous one wasn't big enough for the barbells at my gym). This one will fit around a 2" thick barbell.
customer_reviews.author: Nikibeach

customer_reviews.title: Slips and cuts into back
customer_reviews.text: Experienced major slippage. Had to stop mid set multiple times because the slot that goes over the bar finds its way on my back and the Velcro does not keep it sealed. Anyone that takes their workouts seriously knows it stinks when you have to stop mid-set. I am trying one with anti-slip design. I went cheap and got what I paid for. Maybe one day I will learn...
customer_reviews.author: Aric M. Arnett

customer_reviews.title: Generally a good budget pad, but with a caveat
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good budget pad. My main problem is that it will sometimes shift so that the seam is facing down - that is, pointing directly at your back. When this happens, the bar can slide down into the seam and press your back.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the lack of support it offered. It felt like the barbell didn't even have a pad. It was hurting me so I had to go back to my older one which was way more supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Chelly

customer_reviews.title: awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This fit my olympic sized bar without issues. It's not super bulky but offers enough cushion to make back squats more comfortable. No issues with the velcro, it has held in place since I put it on the bar. I do adjust it so the seam isn't against my body before I get under the bar. It does slide easily along the bar, but this is mostly a good thing for easy adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: ktlvskt

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: Fits my bar perfect and feels very good on shoulders/neck. I've been looking at these for a while and I'm at the point where the weight I was using was very uncomfortable while doing squats so I finally purchased this and glad I did. Price is great and does the job. I have nothing to compare to but what more could you really need
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This is very comfortable and easy to use. Great price point too.
customer_reviews.author: Evans Family

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for my older shoulder pad that I was ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement for my older shoulder pad that I was using for free standing squats. It's funny how you don't realize how worn something is until you replace it with something newer.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: Fits and feels very nice. I will say, like the others, that it may be too tight to fit around the larger diameter barbells. Other than that, it's great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy Guy

customer_reviews.title: Must have for squats!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our weight set for doing weighted squats. The bar used to kill my neck and shoulders when doing squats, this pad fixed the problem. It is thick, well made, attached easily, and really takes the pressure off.
customer_reviews.author: Clancy0428

customer_reviews.title: Works as stated. I have an olympic 2" weight ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as stated. I have an olympic 2" weight set with olympic bar and it fits snuggly. The velcro is very aggressive and weak hands (wife) have a difficult time removing but not me the manly brut that I am, ha,ha.
customer_reviews.author: Brian mowers

customer_reviews.title: A little hard, but does the job
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty good for what I paid for. Doesn't have a cute design or anything, but it works. At first touch I though it was of very hard material and probalby wouldn't do much to help soften the bar. But when I used it it helped improve the tension between me and the bar, so I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Helena

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend and buy it a ha again
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of months of use, this pad is holding solid!!! I use it on a barbell with 270lbs. and has not lost its shape of protection use. It's long enough to protect wide shoulders. I would recommend and buy it a ha again!!
customer_reviews.author: HAPPY TO TRY THINGS

customer_reviews.title: This item makes working with a Barbell much more comfortable.. Excellent product..
customer_reviews.text: Great Product to use with your barbell. I had a serious neck injury 21 years ago so i have to be very careful when doing squats with barbells on the back of my neck. This item supplies alot of cushion for the back of the neck. More importantly is doesnt make the back of the neck sweat. Outstanding item.
customer_reviews.author: Protech

customer_reviews.title: This does exactly what I hoped it would. Firm ...
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what I hoped it would. Firm padding that doesn't move when I'm doing squats, and really softens the feel of the bar on my back and feels secure. Why didn't I get this sooner?
customer_reviews.author: N. Agnos

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: Pad itself is not bad. However, it became too loose around the barbell and it slipped when I was squatting. Almost lost grip/hold of the bar and could have severely hurt myself.
customer_reviews.author: TJ B.

customer_reviews.title: I use this at the neighborhood monkey bars provides shin ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this at the neighborhood monkey bars provides shin and but padding while locked in for suspended sit ups and back extensions
customer_reviews.author: Honestly

customer_reviews.title: WARNING!
customer_reviews.text: So I get this box and it wreaks of something familiar but I can't put my finger on it so I open it anyway then I see a label that says; WARNING! This product contains Cancer causing materials. Then it hits me formaldehyde (and gosh knows what else)! So Im supposed to have this in my house around my family? Not! The returns truck can't come fast enough to pick it up. I'm no rocket scientist but creating health and fitness products that can cause cancer seems idiotic. Amazon, require these companies to put health and safety info in their product descriptions or you're going to be wasting a lot of resources on returns.
customer_reviews.author: Cast

customer_reviews.title: No More Bruising
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what I wanted it to do: keeps my hips from bruising from hip thrusts!
customer_reviews.author: Kate V

customer_reviews.title: It's a good product and gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product and gets the job done. It was a little harder than I expected it to be though which hurts my neck sometimes but still better than not having it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alina_M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for squats
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for squats! I squat at least once a week for leg day and it is VERY comfortable! It fits my Olympic bar, the bar is thicker than most and it fits fine. Don't spend your hard earned money elsewhere. This is what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Good strong material.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great edition to my workout. The lifting pads at the gym are used and worn down, so bringing my own has really helped my lifting capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Rudnitsky

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect use for performing hip thrusts when using barbell weights! Sturdy and fits around any bar at gym!
customer_reviews.author: GiGi G

customer_reviews.title: Simple and excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Simple and excellent. I have a standard Olympic Barbell (45lbs) and this sleeve fits snuggly and securely, but can be slid to adjust. I have used similar in weight rooms. Keeps the bar from biting the shoulders at 485lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Beckman

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Firm cushion, strong velcro - have been using them for hip thrusts and have not had any problems with them. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: shaun

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Just what was needed for my barbell. It provides needed cushion. Just can be a handful to take off the barbell.
customer_reviews.author: Keyshna

customer_reviews.title: ... - am doing weight training and this helps a great deal when doing weighted squats
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed - am doing weight training and this helps a great deal when doing weighted squats.
customer_reviews.author: kyakr44

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: A no-nonsense bar pad. It seems well made and provides good padding.
customer_reviews.author: JNB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Not too hard, not to soft. Most important, it's not too thick.
customer_reviews.author: Boni Bonneville

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I loved it. But I lost it at the gym :(((
customer_reviews.author: Susana Sacramento

customer_reviews.title: but it rows around my barbell easily.
customer_reviews.text: It does its job, but it rows around my barbell easily.
customer_reviews.author: The Eye-Opened

customer_reviews.title: I use every time
customer_reviews.text: Perfect... I use it every time for squats. It helps the bar feel more secure on the back of my neck, and prevents callouses and discomfort...I strongly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ofthewoodland

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good velcrow
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, good velcrow, closes easily around the barbell and stays closed. A good amount of padding. No pain when doing hip thrusters. The pad is long enough to cover both my hips.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Mandel

customer_reviews.title: Firm, tight
customer_reviews.text: We found it just a couple millimeters short as far as getting it around the bar is concerned. It is extremely comfortable and nice and firm though.
customer_reviews.author: Gannon

customer_reviews.title: but it is padded enough to be comfortable when doing squats
customer_reviews.text: Functions as expected. It is thin enough that I can leave it on when doing bench press, etc. but it is padded enough to be comfortable when doing squats.
customer_reviews.author: jc_madison

customer_reviews.title: Offers great cushioning.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and fits my Olympic bar perfectly. Offers great cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Paul David

customer_reviews.title: Thanks but no thanks.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Invest in a better one. This one does not move when you want it to and DOES move when you don't need it to. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Phillips

customer_reviews.title: works good! enough padding and doesn't fall off and it ...
customer_reviews.text: works good! enough padding and doesn't fall off and it fits on olympic and standard bars
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Started working squats into my routine and this works as advertised. good purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mansfield D

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great to relieve the pressure when lifting a little heavier during body pump.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great For Girls Who Lift
customer_reviews.text: Works great on the Smith Machine and with regular weighed barbell squats, no complaints, all comfort. Girls lift too wooo!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley V.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: A little hard when you first use it...but once "broken in" works great. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jewell White, II

customer_reviews.title: Neck marks
customer_reviews.text: The barbell pad is a neck saver. Even though you try and pinch your shoulder together when squatting I still have a mark on my neck. Thanks for Cap no more marks
customer_reviews.author: Joyner Mosley

customer_reviews.title: Nice barbell pad.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, works to keep my back from hurting. Quick on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Readsforfun

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Squats feel much easier on my traps. Wraps around an Olympic bar. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: HJ

customer_reviews.title: It fit the barbell tight and securely. I purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: It fit the barbell tight and securely. I purchased it because I would get pain on my shoulders from heavy weights when doing squats. I thought this might help and it did. Now I can squat with no pain
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: For the price of the pad, its a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Van Alen

customer_reviews.title: Great cushion
customer_reviews.text: Fits very snuggly and tight on the bar and doesn't move at all plus just enough cushion so the bar doesn't hurt at all. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: ok for the money
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for several months but has now split the foam inside the cover. We rotated the pad and the same thing has happened.
customer_reviews.author: Sngledad04

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my husband and he loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Great material and sturdy enough. He enjoys the comfort of having this bar pad especially on legs day at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Adihas Riohclem

customer_reviews.title: Cushions nicely, but very thick
customer_reviews.text: My trainer told me to buy this, and it seemed to fit whatever bar he had me using at the gym. It's cushiony enough, but it's a little too thick- i felt like i had to put my neck at an odd angle, but not sure if that's because I'm still learning about how to do proper form. I'm also very petite, so maybe I just have a small neck/shoulder area lol..
customer_reviews.author: Tastycakes

customer_reviews.title: Best Value
customer_reviews.text: Works great, feels great. Don't pay any more for a squat pad
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it, fits on the barbell very well and ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it, fits on the barbell very well and when squatting I can't feel the barbell. Gives the right amount of cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This pad is very confortable, and fits well on the barbell.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Njoroge

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just received this. It is not 17 inch long as stated. It measured only 16 inch long. That is good enough for me. So far the Velcro is very strong and sticks firmly. I think that cancer causing thing may be a minor issue. It came to California. So the seller takes some responsibility.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Buyer

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is and it does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad accessory. Very simple and necessary. I like the price and simplicity of it. I recommend it for anyone doing any kind of work out that requires you to rest a bar on your shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Pad splits in 6 months
customer_reviews.text: After using for about 6 months, the inner pad itself started to split from the pressure/weight of the bar. Granted, I use it for fairly heavy weight calf raises on a Smith Machine (360#s) but it's not like I'm doing 500# squats or something.
customer_reviews.author: N Robins

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Taking the pad w me to the gym is better than putting my towel on my shoulders, because I am not using the communal pad at the gym, yuck!
customer_reviews.author: Silverfirexxx

customer_reviews.title: No bruises. Fits all bars
customer_reviews.text: I used this pad on an olympic (thick) bar this morning with 260kg on my back. No bruises or redness. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Simon Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Go-Kart Bar Padding
customer_reviews.text: In the process of restoring a vintage Go-Kart, I found the passenger and driver comfort padding in a state of complete deterioration. These fit a bit loosely but were fine for length. With the curve built into the karts sidebars, the padding works fine. The padding is similar to the original in thickness, and may even be a bit thicker. The velcro (hook/loop) closure is the same as the original and appears to be stitched on very well. These would have come in handy during my teen years when lifting weights was a part of my daily routine, but they now serve me in other ways.
customer_reviews.author: R. Clifton

product_meta.title: Cap Barbell Unisex-adult Workouts Bar Pad Black
product_meta.description: CAP's Bar Pad helps comfort and protect your neck during exercises. Easily attaches to any standard or olympic style bar with a hook and loop closure.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
